ref: 3370 kúṣṭha1 m.n. ʻ the plant Costus speciosus (used as a medicine for takmán -- , a wasting disease with skin eruptions) ʼ AV. 2. *kōṭṭha -- 1. 3. *kuṭha -- 1, kuṭhika<-> m. lex. [Conn. with kúṣṭha -- 2, either original or by pop. etym. because of its use as a specific for leprosy, is poss. EWA i 246: cf. also the oppositions in both words of u ~ ō, ṣṭh ~ ṭh whether after u or ō]
Pa. kuṭṭha -- n. ʻ Costus speciosus ʼ;
Pk. kuṭṭha<-> m.n. ʻ a partic. drug ʼ;
K. kŏṭh, dat. &obrevdotdot f. ʻ Aucklandia costus ʼ;
S. kuṭhu m. ʻ drug made from Costus speciosus ʼ;
P. kuṭṭh f. ʻ a bitter aromatic tonic made from the plant Aucklandia costus and used in fever ʼ;
bhal. kuṭṭh f. ʻ a partic. drug ʼ;
bhal. kuṭṭh f. ʻ a partic. drug ʼ;
H. kuṭh, kuṭ m. ʻ root of C. speciosus or arabicus ʼ.
